item.title: By: william
item.dc:creator: william
item.description: hi , first would like to thank u for such a great set of tutorials/blog all ur projects are ineresting and informitive and set out very well this is a fab web site. i am intreaged though as the setion "RS232 Level Converter" says "The micro controller USART pins need to be connected to a RS-232 Level Converter to connect to a PC for firmware updates using the Tiny PIC Bootloader. Otherwise, after initial programming they can be left disconnected." that rather suggests that no programming board is needed at all apat from a max232/max233 is this true for brand new chips or just all chips which already have boat loaders/firmware?? and whitch programming board do u prefer and do u use the tiny boat loader to program the pic all ways?? thank u very much for the blog and ur answer will
item.content:encoded:
hi , first would like to thank u for such a great set of tutorials/blog all ur projects are ineresting and informitive and set out very well this is a fab web site. i am intreaged though as the setion “RS232 Level Converter” says
“The micro controller USART pins need to be connected to a RS-232 Level Converter to connect to a PC for firmware updates using the Tiny PIC Bootloader. Otherwise, after initial programming they can be left disconnected.”
that rather suggests that no programming board is needed at all apat from a max232/max233 is this true for brand new chips or just all chips which already have boat loaders/firmware?? and whitch programming board do u prefer and do u use the tiny boat loader to program the pic all ways??
thank u very much for the blog and ur answer
will

item.title: By: bods
